titleStmt.title: To the right honourable, the Lords and Commons assembled in the High Court of Parliament of England, sitting at Westminster. The humble petition of divers well-affected citizens of the City of London, and parts adjacent. Together with a paper annexed, of their humble desires, for the allaying and removal of the jealousies and discontents, the visible causes of our sad divisions, and distractions.

notesStmt.note: Annotation on Thomason copy: "The Petition of ye Independent: Leveller; and ye rest of ye sectaries, to joyne the Parliament, Armie, and Citie, togeather, and upon all together to Joyne against the Scott, Aug: 15. 1648".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
